computing_environment: Linux (Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 6.4)
data_usage: Multi-model mean CMIP5 (RCP 2.6 scenario) temperature projections were plotted for the United States, for 2071-2099 relative to 1970-1999.
methodology:
1. For each model at each grid point, the mean annual temperature under the RCP 2.6 scenario was calculated.
2. For each model, these data were re-gridded to a common grid.
3. For each model at each grid point, the mean temperature under the RCP 2.6 scenario was calculated for two periods: 1970-1999 and 2071-2099.
4. At each grid point, the mean temperature for the two periods was computed by averaging the following models:
bcc-csm1-1, bcc-csm1-1-m, BNU-ESM, CanESM2, CCSM4, CESM1-CAM5, CNRM-CM5, CSIRO-Mk3-6-0, EC-EARTH, FGOALS-g2, FIO-ESM, GFDL-CM3, GFDL-ESM2G, GFDL-ESM2M, GISS-E2-H, GISS-E2-R, HadGEM2-A0, HadGEM2-ES, IPSL-CM5A-LR, IPSL-CM5A-MR, MIROC5, MIROC-ESM, MIROC-ESM-CHEM, MPI-ESM-LR, MPI-ESM-MR, MRI-CGCM3, NorESM1-ME, and NorESM1-M.
5. At each grid point, the difference in projected temperature was calculated for 2071-2099 minus 1970-1999.
6. Data were plotted for grid points in the United States.
output_artifacts:
tas_rcp26_1970-1999_2071-2099_change.nc
temp_scenarios_annual.eps
temp_scenarios_annual_new_colors_darker.eps
temp_scenarios_annual_new_colors_darker.png
temp_scenarios_HI_annual.eps
temp_scenarios_HI_annual_new_colors_darker.eps
temp_scenarios_HI_annual_new_colors_darker.png
config.py
plot_annual_temp_maps.py
2-9_a.png
CS_projected temperature change_RCPs_V9.png
